user_input: What is a Collection in openBIS?
retrieved_contexts:
['## Collection In openBIS, a *Collection* is a folder with user-defined [*Properties*](/en/concepts#property) located on the third level of the hierarchical data structure (Space/Project/**Collection**/Object). A *Collection* is always part of a [*Project*](/en/concepts#project). *Collections* of the same type are described by the same set of *Properties*. *Collection* types are defined as part of the openBIS [masterdata](/en/concepts#masterdata). [*Datasets*](/en/concepts#dataset) can be attached to *Collections*. A *Collection* can logically group an unlimited number of [*Object*](/en/concepts#object) of one or more *Object* types. For instance, a *Collection* of the type "Measurement Devices" can be used to organize *Objects* of the type "Instrument" in the [Inventory](/en/concepts#inventory). A *Collection* of the type "Default Experiment" can be used to organize *Objects* of the type "Experimental Step" in the [Lab Notebook](/en/concepts#lab-notebook).', '## Collection In openBIS, a *Collection* is a folder with user-defined [*Properties*](/en/concepts#property) located on the third level of the hierarchical data structure (Space/Project/**Collection**/Object). A *Collection* is always part of a [*Project*](/en/concepts#project). *Collections* of the same type are described by the same set of *Properties*. *Collection* types are defined as part of the openBIS [masterdata](/en/concepts#masterdata). [*Datasets*](/en/concepts#dataset) can be attached to *Collections*. A *Collection* can logically group an unlimited number of [*Object*](/en/concepts#object) of one or more *Object* types. For instance, a *Collection* of the type "Measurement Devices" can be used to organize *Objects* of the type "Instrument" in the [Inventory](/en/concepts#inventory). A *Collection* of the type "Default Experiment" can be used to organize *Objects* of the type "Experimental Step" in the [Lab Notebook](/en/concepts#lab-notebook).', '## OverviewopenBIS has the following data structure:

1. **Space**: entity with *Code and *Description**
2. **Project**: entity with *Code* and *Description*
3. **Experiment/Collection:** entity with *user-defined properties*
4. **Object**: entity with *user-defined properties*
5. **Dataset**: folder where data files are stored. A dataset has *user-defined properties*

![image info](../../_images/openbis-data-model-v3.png)

*Space* is the top level. Below *Spaces* there are *Projects* and below *Projects* there are *Experiments/Collections*.
In the general openBIS data model, *Objects* can:

* be shared across *Spaces* (i.e. they do not belong to any Space)
* belong to a *Space*
* belong to a *Project*
* belong to an *Experiment/Collection*

*Datasets* can be associated only to *Experiments/Collections* or to *Objects*.', '## 5.1 Standard Data StoreStandard Data Store mode depicts a workflow where datasets are stored directly in the OpenBIS
instance. In this mode user can download/upload files to OpenBIS, search for objects/datasets
fulfilling filtering criteria
and get/set properties of objects/collections represented by datasets in current repository.', '# Inventory Of Materials And Methods

The generic openBIS ELN-LIMS only has one predefined Object type for the Inventory, *General Protocol*, in the General Protocols Collection in the Methods folder. The Material folder is empty. Additional Object types and Collections must be created by an openBIS instance admin, based on the needs of the lab(s).']
response:
In openBIS, a **Collection** is a folder-like entity that sits on the third level of the hierarchical data structure, positioned beneath **Spaces** and **Projects** (i.e., *Space/Project/Collection/Objects*). It serves as a logical grouping tool for organizing **Objects** (e.g., instruments, experimental steps, or protocols) within a **Project**.  

Key characteristics of a Collection:  
1. **User-Defined Properties**: Each Collection has custom properties tailored to its purpose, such as "Measurement Devices" or "Default Experiment."  
2. **Grouping Objects**: A Collection can hold an unlimited number of **Objects** of one or more types. For example, a "Measurement Devices" Collection might organize *Instrument* Objects, while a "Default Experiment" Collection might group *Experimental Step* Objects.  
3. **Dataset Association**: Collections can be linked to **Datasets**, which are folders for storing files. This allows data files to be tied to specific organizational contexts.  
4. **Masterdata-Driven**: Collection types are defined in the openBIS **masterdata**, ensuring consistency across similar Collections (e.g., all "Inventory" Collections share the same property structure).  

Collections are distinct from **Experiments** in the hierarchy but often work together, as Datasets can be attached to both. They are essential for structuring data in openBIS, enabling efficient categorization and management of lab materials, methods, and experimental workflows.
reference: In openBIS, a Collection is a folder with user-defined Properties located on the third level of the hierarchical data structure (Space/Project/ Collection /Object). A Collection is always part of a Project . Collections of the same type are described by the same set of Properties . Collection types are defined as part of the openBIS masterdata. Datasets can be attached to Collections . A Collection can logically group an unlimited number of Object of one or more Object types. For instance, a Collection of the type "Measurement Devices" can be used to organize Objects of the type "Instrument" in the Inventory. A Collection of the type "Default Experiment" can be used to organize Objects of the type "Experimental Step" in the Lab Notebook.

user_input: What are the policies regarding usage and maintenance of the BAM Data Store?
retrieved_contexts: ['Question: Who can use the Data Store? Is the use of the Data Store mandatory? Answer: In the future, all BAM employees who work with research data will be able to use the Data Store. Divisions that have registered for the rollout commit themselves to using the Data Store after the end of the onboarding phase. It is the responsibility of the division head to ensure that the Data Store is used appropriately.', 'Here you will find step-by-step video tutorials to help you learn how to use the BAM Data Store effectively. These tutorials provide hands-on guidance, walking you through key processes to build your knowledge and skills. If you need a tutorial on a specific topic that is not covered, please contact the Data Store Team for support: datastore@bam.de. Tutorial 1: Overview of the Data Store In this step-by-step video tutorial, you will get familiar with the BAM Data Store and its key components: - **Overview of Data Store** ‚Äì Understand the structure and functionality of the BAM Data Store. - **Overview of BAM Inventory** ‚Äì Learn how to manage and track inventory efficiently. - **Overview of ELN** ‚Äì Get introduced to the Electronic Lab Notebook (ELN) and its features. - **Role and Rights** ‚Äì Discover the responsibilities and permissions of Data Store users.', 'Here you find an answer to "How do I ‚Ä¶?" related questions on how to use the BAM Data Store and its underlying software - openBIS. These goal-oriented instructions should help you accomplish specific tasks. If the function you are looking for is missing, please contact the Data Store Team at datastore@bam.de.', 'üìñ How-to guides Step-by-step instructions for openBIS functions. Go to Guides ‚ùì FAQ Frequently asked questions about Data Store and openBIS. View FAQ üë• Use cases Discover Use cases of the Data Store. Discover Use cases # What is the Data Store? **The Data Store is the central system for research data management (RDM) at BAM.**', 'In this step-by-step video tutorials you will get familiar with the BAM Data Store and its key components: - **Overview of Data Store** ‚Äì Understand the structure and functionality of the BAM Data Store. - **Overview of BAM Inventory** ‚Äì Learn how to manage and track inventory efficiently. - **Overview of ELN** ‚Äì Get introduced to the Electronic Lab Notebook (ELN) and its features. - **Role and Rights** ‚Äì Discover the responsibilities and permissions of Data Store users.']
response:
The BAM Data Store is designed to be a central hub for research data management (RDM) at BAM, ensuring standardized and efficient handling of data across the organization. Here‚Äôs a summary of the key policies:  

1. **Usage Policy**:  
   - **Mandatory Adoption**: All BAM employees working with research data will eventually be required to use the Data Store. Divisions that have signed up for the rollout commit to using it after the onboarding phase.  
   - **Responsibility**: Division heads are tasked with ensuring their teams adhere to proper usage guidelines and leverage the system effectively.  

2. **Access and Roles**:  
   - Users are assigned specific roles and permissions (e.g., data entry, management, or analysis) to align with their responsibilities. These rights are defined in the system‚Äôs role-and-rights framework.  

3. **Support and Maintenance**:  
   - While the context does not explicitly detail maintenance protocols, the Data Store Team is available to address questions, resolve issues, or provide guidance on specific tasks (e.g., troubleshooting, feature usage, or workflow optimization). For tailored support, you can reach out to **datastore@bam.de**.  

If you need further clarification or have specific questions about workflows, roles, or system features, feel free to ask! üìö
reference: Who can use the Data Store? Is the use of the Data Store mandatory? In the future, all BAM employees who work with research data will be able to use the Data Store. Divisions that have registered for the rollout commit themselves to using the Data Store after the end of the onboarding phase. It is the responsibility of the division head to ensure that the Data Store is used appropriately. Who is responsible for maintaining the Data Store? The Data Store is operated as a central service by the central IT (VP.2). Training and consulting is provided by the eScience section (VP.1). The divisions themselves are responsible for the content of their group and maintenance of metadata and data. What kind of data should be stored and what data should NOT be stored in the Data Store?

['## Register Experimental Steps

### **Comments Log**Several comments can be added by different users who have write-access to a given user Space:

1. Click the button in the **Comments** section.
2. Enter the **comment**.
3. Click **Save.**', '## Feature

### RevokeUserAccessMaintenanceTask

For this to work the services should be able to list the available
users. If you use any service that doesn‚Äôt allow it, the task
automatically disables itself because is impossible to know if the users
are active or not.

| Service | Compatible |
| --- | --- |
| CrowdAuthenticationService | NO |
| DummyAuthenticationService | NO |
| NullAuthenticationService | NO |
| FileAuthenticationService | YES |
| LDAPAuthenticationService | YES |

**Configuration**:

This maintenance task automatically uses the services already configured
on the server.

**Example**:

**plugin.properties**

```
class = ch.systemsx.cisd.openbis.generic.server.task.RevokeUserAccessMaintenanceTask
interval = 60 s
```', '## What UserManagementMaintenanceTask does

      1. A user leaving the group and joining it again later but was
         always known by the authentication service.
      2. A user leaving the group and the institution. That it, the
         user is no longer known by the authentication service. But
         later another user with the same user id is joining the
         group.
   4. Creates common samples if they do not exist.
   5. Creates common experiments (and necessary projects) if they do
      not exist.
5. Assigns home spaces in accordance to the following rules:

1. If the user has no home space the personal user space of the
   first group of the JSON configuration file will become the home
   space.
2. The home space will not be changed if its code doesn‚Äôt start

3. If the user leaves a group the home space will be removed.', '## Register users from the admin UI

8. To assign a role to a user, first the **Level** needs to be selected
   (Instance, Space, Project) .
9. If level is Instance, you can directly select a role (Admin, Observer). If the level is Space or Project, you first need to select the Space or Project and then assign a [Role](#openbis-roles).

Note: for using the ELN interface, it is necessary to assign every user
or user group the OBSERVER role to the space ELN\_SETTINGS.', '## What UserManagementMaintenanceTask doesEach time this maintenance task is executed (according to the scheduling
interval of `plugin.properties`) the JSON configuration file will be
read first. The task does the following:

1. Updates mapping file of data store shares if

2. Creates global spaces if they do not exist and allows

3. Revokes all users unknown by the authentication service. These users

4. Does for each specified group the following:

1. Creates the following two authorization groups if they do not
   exist:']
response: Users can leave feedback by adding comments in the **Comments section** of their workspace. To do this, click the **Comments** button, enter your feedback, and save it. This feature allows collaborative input and is accessible to users with write permissions to the space.
reference: Please leave your feedback in this Onboarding MsTeams channel.

response:
The BAM Data Store welcome page provides an introduction to the system and its core components, guiding users through key functionalities. It includes:  
- **Overview of the Data Store**: A summary of its structure and purpose.  
- **BAM Inventory**: Instructions on managing and tracking inventory efficiently.  
- **Electronic Lab Notebook (ELN)**: An introduction to its features for lab documentation.  
- **Role and Rights**: Details about user responsibilities and permissions.  
Additionally, it likely links to tutorials and resources (like the step-by-step videos) to help users explore the system further. If you need specific guidance, the welcome page may also direct you to contact the Data Store Team for support.
reference: This Wiki provides information on the BAM Data Store - the central system for research data management at the Bundesanstalt fr Materialforschung und -prfung (BAM).

user_input: How do you configure Parent and Child hints and limits in Settings?
retrieved_contexts:
['## Parent-child relationships - [ ] [Customize Parents and Children sections in Object Forms](/en/How_to_guides/Customize_parents_and_children_sections) - [ ] [Add a hint in Parents and Children sections](/en/How_to_guides/Add_hint_parents_and_children_sections) ## Barcodes - [ ] [Enable Barcodes](/en/How_to_guides/Enable_barcodes)', 'To assign [Parent and Children](/en/concepts#parent-child-relationship) to Objects of the type - Experimental Step, select relevant Object, click on the **Edit** tab. In the *Parent* and *Children* section, click **Search The process is as follows: Step 1: Click on Edit tab Step 2: Navigate to the Parent and Children sections Step 3: Click Search Any Step 4: Select Object Type Step 5: Enter Code or Name of the Objects to connect Step 6: Review the entries and Save.', 'In the left main menu, under **Utilities** select **Settings**. The Select Group Settings drop-down menu will appear, select your **division number** to open your group settings. Click on the **Edit** tab, navigate to the Object type definitions Extension section, options to modify those sections within an Object type will be displayed. In the **Hints for** part of settings there is an option to set a particular Object type(s) as Parent(s) or Child(ren) and limit the number of them. By pressing the **+** tab on the right corner of the **Hints for** row, you can extend the number of the Parents and Children. In case, if minimal number of Parents and/or Children is specified, the required number of those is mandatory to enter and the form cannot be saved until this condition is satisfied. Annotation to these connections can be supported by using the Properties. To add Property press **+** left to the Parent(s)/Child(ren) field. Review the entries and **Save**. --- ```mermaid graph TB;', 'The process is as follows: Step 1: Select Settings Step 2: Select division number Step 3: Click on Edit tab Step 4: Navigate to Object type definitions Extension section Step 5: Select an Object type Step 6: In the Hints for part set Parent(s) and/or Child(ren) to the particular Object type Step 7: Specify minimal and maximal number of Parents and Children Step 8: Press + tab to add annotations Step 9: Review the entries and Save.', '# Customise Parents and Children Sections in Object FormsThe **Parents** and **Children** sections are automatically created in
all *Object* forms. It is possible to customise or remove these
sections, from the **Settings**, under **Utilities**.

Let‚Äôs consider an example. The default *Experimental Step*, present in
all openBIS instances, looks like the picture below: in the **Parents**
section, **General Protocol** is predefined. If we want to add a General
Protocol to the form, we use the **Search** or **Paste** options next to
General Protocol. If we want to add another parent, for example a
**Sample**, we need to use the **Search Any** or **Paste Any** next to
Parents. See also [Add parents and children to Experimental
Steps.](../../general-users/lab-notebook.html#add-parents-and-children-to-experimental-steps)

![image info](../../../_images/exp-step-parents-children-default.png)']
response:
To configure Parent and Child hints and limits in Settings, follow these steps:  

1. **Access Group Settings**:  
   - Navigate to the left main menu, select **Utilities**, then **Settings**.  
   - Choose your **division number** to open your group settings.  

2. **Edit Object Type Definitions**:  
   - Click the **Edit** tab.  
   - Navigate to the **Object type definitions Extension section**.  

3. **Set Parent/Child Hints**:  
   - Select the specific **Object type** you want to configure.  
   - In the **Hints for** section, specify which Object types should act as **Parents** or **Children**.  
   - Use the **+** button to add multiple Parent/Child relationships if needed.  

4. **Define Limits**:  
   - Set **minimal** and **maximal** numbers for Parents and/or Children.  
   - If minimums are defined, they become mandatory fields, and the form cannot be saved without them.  

5. **Add Annotations (Optional)**:  
   - Use the **+** button left of the Parent/Child fields to add descriptive annotations for clarity.  

6. **Save Changes**:  
   - Review all entries and click **Save** to apply the configuration.  

This process ensures your Object forms enforce required Parent/Child relationships while allowing flexibility for data entry. Let me know if you'd like an example!
reference: In the left main menu, under Utilities select Settings . The Select Group Settings drop-down menu will appear, select your division number to open your group settings. Click on the Edit tab, navigate to the Object type definitions Extension section, options to modify those sections within an Object type will be displayed. In the Hints for part of settings there is an option to set a particular Object type(s) as Parent(s) or Child(ren) and limit the number of them. By pressing the + tab on the right corner of the Hints for row, you can extend the number of the Parents and Children. In case, if minimal number of Parents and/or Children is specified, the required number of those is mandatory to enter and the form cannot be saved until this condition is satisfied. Annotation to these connections can be supported by using the Properties. To add Property press + left to the Parent(s)/Child(ren) field. Review the entries and Save .

user_input: How do you perform batch registration of Objects using the Excel template?
retrieved_contexts:
['Multiple Objects can be registered in a **Collection** via import **Excel Template**. Navigate to the relevant **Collection**, open the **More** drop-down menu, and select **XLS Batch Register Objects**. **Download** the **Template**, fill out the form and enter values for all properties, upload it and click ** The process is as follows: Step 1: Open More drop-down menu Step 2: Select XLS Batch Register Objects Step 3: Click on Template Download, update the file and enter values for all mandatory (*) Properties Step 4: Upload the file Step 5: Review the entries and Accept.', '## Batch register entries in a Collection

### Batch registration via Excel template file

**Note:** no other separators (e.g ‚Äú,‚Äù or  ‚Äú;‚Äù) should be used,
otherwise an error will be thrown.

2. **Register Objects and assign parents in the same batch registration
   process.**

If you want to register a few *Objects* and at the same time establish a
parent-child relationship between some of them, you can do so by using
the **$** and **Parents** columns. In the example below we want to
register 2 *Objects*, antibody 1 and antibody 2. We want to assign
antibody 1 as parent of antibody 2. In the **$ column** corresponding to
antibody 1 we need to enter numbers or letters proceeded by the $ symbol
(i.e. $1, or $parent1). In the **Parents** column of antibody 2, we need
to use the same value used in the **$ column** for antibody 1.

![image info](../../_images/register-objects-assign-parents-in-same-transaction.png)

#### Date format

For date fields, the expected format is YYYY-MM-DD.', 'The process is as follows: Step 1: Open More drop-down menu Step 2: Select XLS Batch Register Objects Step 3: Click on Template Download (The Excel Template should contain at least two sheets, the SAMPLE and STORAGE_POSITION metadata.) Step 4: Upload the file Step 5: Review the entries and click Accept.', '## Batch register entries in a Collection

### Batch registration via Excel template file

1. Navigate to the relevant collection (e.g. **Samples**).
2. Select **XLS Batch Register Objects** from the **More** drop-down menu (see figure above)
3. Download the **template** file and fill in the relevant information.
   (Example file: [SAMPLE-COLLECTION-REGISTRATION-SAMPLE-STORAGE\_POSITION-template](../../_downloads/1d489416489956f855a6bba60898aeb8/SAMPLE-COLLECTION-REGISTRATION-SAMPLE-STORAGE_POSITION-template-2.xlsx))
4. Upload the file.

#### **Codes**', '## Batch register entries in a Collection

### Batch registration via Excel template file

Codes and labels of vocabulary terms can be seen under
**Utilities -> Vocabulary Browser**.

#### Assign parents

1. **Assign already existing parents**

If the parents you want to assign to your Objects are already registered
in openBIS, in the **Parents** column of the Excel file, you can assign
the relationship, by providing the identifier of the parent (i.e. /SPACE
code/PROJECT code/OBJECT code). If you want to add multiple parents to
one Object, every identifier should be in a new line in the
corresponding Excel cell. A new line in an Excel cell is entered with
the keyboard shortcuts **Alt** + **Enter.**

Example file:
[SAMPLE-COLLECTION-REGISTRATION-ANTIBODY-STORAGE\_POSITION-template](../../_downloads/680e52b09dbbdd028396036516fdf941/SAMPLE-COLLECTION-REGISTRATION-ANTIBODY-STORAGE_POSITION-template-1.xlsx)']
response:
To perform batch registration of Objects using an Excel template in openBIS, follow these steps:  

1. **Navigate to the Collection**: Go to the relevant Collection (e.g., *Samples* or *Storage Positions*) where you want to register the Objects.  
2. **Download the Template**:  
   - Click the **More** dropdown menu and select **XLS Batch Register Objects**.  
   - Download the template file. For storage positions, ensure the template includes at least two sheets: **SAMPLE** and **STORAGE_POSITION**.  
3. **Fill the Template**:  
   - Complete all mandatory fields (*).  
   - For date fields, use the format **YYYY-MM-DD**.  
   - If assigning parent-child relationships:  
     - Use the **$** column to label the parent (e.g., `$1` or `$parent1`).  
     - In the **Parents** column of the child Object, enter the same identifier (e.g., `$1`).  
   - For existing parents, input their full identifier (e.g., `/SPACE/PROJECT/OBJECT`). If multiple parents are needed, separate them with **Alt** + **Enter** in the same cell.  
4. **Upload the File**:  
   - Return to the Collection and upload the completed template.  
5. **Review and Accept**:  
   - Review the entries for accuracy.  
   - Click **Accept** to finalize the registration.  

This method streamlines bulk data entry while maintaining relationships and metadata integrity. Let me know if you need help with specific templates or parent assignments!
reference: Multiple Objects can be registered in a Collection via import Excel Template . Navigate to the relevant Collection , open the More drop-down menu, and select XLS Batch Register Objects . Download the Template , fill out the form and enter values for all properties, upload it and click Accept . To confirm batch registration, navigate to updated Collection . To assign Parents to objects during registration, first assign numbers to the Parents in the $ column (e.g., $1). Then assign the number of a Parent ($1) to an Object in the Parents column to establish the relationship.

user_input: How do you batch register or update storage positions?
retrieved_contexts:
['## Batch update storage positionsTo update several storage positions, we can use the batch update option
from the Object Browser:

1. Go to the **Object Browser** under **Utilities** in the main menu
2. Select the object type **Storage Position** from the dropdown menu
   (see picture)
   ![image info](../../_images/Batch-update-storage-positions.png)
3. Use the table **Filter** to select the storage positions you want to
   update
   (see [Tables](additional-functionalities.html#tables))
4. Export the table (see
   [Tables](additional-functionalities.html#tables))
5. Edit the file to make the changes needed (e.g. change the name of a
   box, change the storage, change a box position, change box size etc)
6. Select **XLS Batch Update Objects** from the **More..** dropdown.

![image info](../../_images/batch-update-entries-object-browser.png)

7. Import the file you modified before and update the storage
positions.

Updated on April 25, 2023', '## Allocate storage positions to samples

### Batch register storage positions

Storage positions are modelled in openBIS as children of other entries.
To register the positions for several samples with the Batch
Registration using the .tsv template, first the parent samples need to
be registered in openBIS. In a second step, the positions are assigned.

To assign storage positions in batch mode follow the steps below:

> 1. Select **Storage positions** from the **Batch Registration** drop
>    down menu.
> 2. Download the **template file**.
> 3. Remove the **identifier** column from the file (identifiers need
>    to be automatically generated by openBIS).
> 4. Fill in the **parents** column. These are the identifiers of the
>    samples for which we want to register the storage
>    positions(/MATERIALS/PROJECT/OBJECT\_CODE).
> 5. Fill the remaining information about the storage positions.
> 6. Save the file and upload with the **Batch Registration**.', '## Allocate storage positions to samples

### Batch register storage positions

An example file can be found
here: [SAMPLE-STORAGE\_POSITION-template](../../_downloads/8876503dbbe4fa8ebd95c115324e9367/SAMPLE-STORAGE_POSITION-template.xlsx)

Updated on April 26, 2023', '## Allocate storage positions to samples

### Register storage position for a single sample

By default, the storage only keeps track of locations. If the **Storage
Position** has been configured by an *Instance admin* to have additional
metadata (e.g. freezing date), these can be added by clicking on the
link in the storage table, as shown below. The link becomes available
after saving the sample.

![image info](../../_images/storage-position-table-in-sample-1024x248.png)

The additional information can be entered in the **Storage Position**
*Object* form.



### Batch register storage positions#### XLS Batch Registration

With the new XLS batch registration, samples and their storage positions
can be registered in one transaction using the XLS template file, as
explained in [Batch register entries in a
Collection](inventory-of-materials-and-methods.html#batch-register-entries-in-a-collection).

#### Batch Registration with TSV file', '## Add metadata to Storage PositionsStorage positions by default have the following metadata:

1. Storage code
2. Storage rack row
3. Storage rack column
4. Box name
5. Box size
6. Box position
7. User id

It is possible to add additional information. This can be done by an
*Instance Admin* by editing the *Object* Type **STORAGE\_POSITION** in
the admin interface (see [New Entity Type Registration](new-entity-type-registration.html)).']
response:
To **batch register or update storage positions** in openBIS, follow these structured steps based on the system‚Äôs capabilities:

---

### **1. Batch Register Storage Positions**  
This method is used to assign storage positions to multiple samples at once.  

**Steps:**  
1. **Access Batch Registration:**  
   - Navigate to the **Batch Registration** tool in openBIS.  
   - Select **"Storage positions"** from the dropdown menu.  

2. **Download the Template:**  
   - Download the provided template file (e.g., `SAMPLE-STORAGE_POSITION-template.xlsx`).  

3. **Prepare the File:**  
   - **Remove the "Identifier" column** (openBIS will auto-generate this).  
   - **Fill the "Parents" column** with the sample identifiers (e.g., `/MATERIALS/PROJECT/OBJECT_CODE`).  
   - Populate other fields like storage code, rack row/column, box name, size, and position.  

4. **Upload and Submit:**  
   - Save the modified file and upload it via the **Batch Registration** tool.  

**Note:** This method allows registering samples and their storage positions in a single transaction.  

---

### **2. Batch Update Storage Positions**  
Use this to modify existing storage positions (e.g., change locations, metadata).  

**Steps:**  
1. **Open Object Browser:**  
   - Go to **Utilities > Object Browser**.  
   - Select **"Storage Position"** as the object type.  

2. **Filter and Export:**  
   - Use the **Filter table** to select the storage positions you want to update.  
   - Export the selected entries to a file (e.g., Excel).  

3. **Edit the File:**  
   - Modify the data (e.g., update storage code, box positions, or metadata).  

4. **Import and Update:**  
   - Use the **"XLS Batch Update Objects"** option from the **More..** dropdown.  
   - Import the edited file to apply changes.  

---

### **Key Notes**  
- **Templates:** The `SAMPLE-STORAGE_POSITION-template.xlsx` file is available for reference (see [here](../../_downloads/8876503dbbe4fa8ebd95c115324e9367/SAMPLE-STORAGE_POSITION-template.xlsx)).  
- **Metadata:** Additional fields (e.g., freezing dates) can be added via the **Object Type** configuration by an *Instance Admin*.  

Let me know if you need help creating a template or adjusting specific fields!
reference: To allocate storage position to multiple Objects, the Data Store Steward(s) for your group must customize the storage for Objects and Enable object types in drop-downs so that Allowed object types are displayed in Excel spreadsheet for batch registration.

user_input: How do you batch update Objects using an Excel template?
retrieved_contexts:
['Multiple **Objects** can be updated in a **Collection** using an Excel Template. Navigate to the relevant **Collection** (in the Inventory or Lab Notebook) and click on the **COLUMNS** tab in the Collection form. Select the *Identifier* of the Properties you want to update. If you have multiple Objects, you can filter the table. To export the Excel table for the selected Properties, click on the **EXPORTS** tab and select **Import Compatible** (Yes); **Columns** ( The process is as follows: Step 1: Click on Columns tab Step 2: Press show all Step 3: Click on Exports tab: Step 4: Select Import Compatible (Yes), Columns(All) (default order), Rows(All) Pages Step 5: Click on Export Step 6: Update the Excel Template file and save it Step 7: Click on More drop-down menu (Object form) Step 8: Select XLS Batch Update Objects Step 9: Upload the Excel Template file Step 10: Review the entries and Accept.', '## Batch update entries in several CollectionsIt is possible to batch update *Objects* that belong to different
*Collections*.

This can be done from the **Object Browser** page, under **Utilities**.
Two options are available:

1. **XLS Batch Update Objects**: batch update via Excel template file.
2. **TSV Batch Update Objects**: batch update via .tsv template file.

![image info](../../_images/batch-register-entries-object-browser-1.png)



### XLS Batch Update ObjectsThis option for batch update is available since openBIS version 20.10.3.
It allows to update *Objects* of different types that belong to
different *Collections*.

You can select which types you want to update from the list of available
types.

![image info](../../_images/object-browser-xls-batch-update.png)', 'Multiple Objects can be registered in a **Collection** via import **Excel Template**. Navigate to the relevant **Collection**, open the **More** drop-down menu, and select **XLS Batch Register Objects**. **Download** the **Template**, fill out the form and enter values for all properties, upload it and click ** The process is as follows: Step 1: Open More drop-down menu Step 2: Select XLS Batch Register Objects Step 3: Click on Template Download, update the file and enter values for all mandatory (*) Properties Step 4: Upload the file Step 5: Review the entries and Accept.', '## Batch update entries in several Collections

### XLS Batch Update Objects

You can then download the template that will allow you to update
*Objects* of the selected types to single or multiple *Collections*. The
*Space, Project, Collection* need to be entered in the file. The
complete path for *Projects* and *Collections* need to be used. In
addition, identifiers for the *Objects* need to be provided: identifiers
are unique in openBIS, by providing them openBIS will know which
*Objects* have to be updated. Example file:
[SAMPLE-GENERAL-REGISTRATION-EXPERIMENTAL\_STEP-MASS\_MEASUREMENT-SAMPLE-template](../../_downloads/57c14c7b3462ab4548df7acf13a44f3d/SAMPLE-GENERAL-REGISTRATION-EXPERIMENTAL_STEP-MASS_MEASUREMENT-SAMPLE-template-1.xlsx)', '## Batch update entries in a Collection

### TSV Batch Update Objects

4. Download the available **template**
5. Fill in the **identifiers** of the objects you want to update
   (identifiers are unique in openBIS. This is how openBIS knows what to
   update). You can copy the identifiers from the identifier column in the
   table and paste them in the file. Identifiers have this format:
   /MATERIALS/SAMPLES/SAMPLE1.
6. Fill in the values in the columns you want to update
7. Save the file and upload it via the **XLS Batch Update
   Objects** from the **More..** dropdown

**Note**:

If a column is removed from the file or a cell in a column is left empty
the corresponding values of updated samples will be preserved.

To delete a value/connection from openBIS one needs to enter
![image info](../../_images/Screenshot-2022-10-13-at-15.59.01-1.png)
**\_ \_DELETE\_ \_** into the corresponding cell in the file.

Updated on April 25, 2023']
response:
To batch update **Objects** using an Excel template in openBIS, follow these steps:  

1. **Access the Object Browser**: Navigate to the **Object Browser** page and locate the **Utilities** section.  
2. **Select XLS Batch Update Objects**: Click this option to open the batch update interface.  
3. **Choose Object Types**: From the list of available types, select the specific **Object types** you want to update.  
4. **Download the Template**: Download the Excel template file provided. This template includes columns for the **Space, Project, Collection** paths (full paths are required) and the **identifiers** of the Objects you want to update.  
5. **Fill in the Template**:  
   - Enter the unique **identifiers** of the Objects (e.g., `/MATERIALS/SAMPLES/SAMPLE1`).  
   - Update the values in the columns corresponding to the properties you want to change.  
   - To **delete** a value or connection, enter `__DELETE__` in the relevant cell.  
6. **Upload the File**: Save the updated Excel file and upload it via the **XLS Batch Update Objects** tool.  
7. **Review and Accept**: Review the entries in the system and confirm the updates.  

This method allows you to update multiple Objects across different Collections efficiently. For detailed examples, refer to the provided template files in the documentation. Let me know if you need further clarification!
reference: Multiple Objects can be updated in a Collection using an Excel Template. Navigate to the relevant Collection (in the Inventory or Lab Notebook) and click on the COLUMNS tab in the Collection form. Select the Identifier of the Properties you want to update. If you have multiple Objects, you can filter the table. To export the Excel table for the selected Properties, click on the EXPORTS tab and select Import Compatible (Yes); Columns (All) (default order); Rows (All) pages/Current page/Selected rows (depending on the Objects you want to export and update). Click EXPORT to download the table. Modify the file and save it. In the Object form, click the More drop-down menu and select XLS Batch Update . Upload the file and press Accept . To confirm batch update, navigate to updated Collection .

user_input: What is the purpose of the 'How do I?' guides/Box designs?
retrieved_contexts: ['Here you find an answer to "How do I ‚Ä¶?" related questions on how to use the BAM Data Store and its underlying software - openBIS. These goal-oriented instructions should help you accomplish specific tasks. If the function you are looking for is missing, please contact the Data Store Team at datastore@bam.de.', 'Here you find "How do I ‚Ä¶?" related to functions of the BAM Data Store and its underlying software openBIS. Goal-oriented instructions should help you accomplish specific tasks. If the function you are looking for is missing, please contact the Data Store Team at datastore@bam.de. How to start Log in to the BAM Data Store openBIS Data Structure Manage Access to Spaces and Project', 'To register sequential Experimental Steps, register a new [Object](/en/concepts#object) at the Object level. To do this, select relevant Experimental Step - Object, click on the **+ New** tab, fill out relevant information, review and **Save**. >Note that the new Experimental Step is organized under a Children drop-down in the left-hand main menu.{.is-info} --- graph TB; The process is as follows: Step 1: Click on + New tab Step 2: Select an Object Type - Experimental Step Step 3: Fill out the Experimental Step form Alternatively, select relevant Template Step 4: Click on Templates tab, select Template, modify Object name and complete relevant information Step 5: Review the entries and Save.', 'To register non-sequential Experimental steps, register a new [Object](/en/concepts#object) at the Collection level (Default Experiment). Navigate to relevant - Default Experiment, click the **+ New** tab, select **Experimental Step** in the Select an object type drop-down menu. Fill out the New Experimental Step form, display Identification Info (if hidden, open the More drop-down menu and select Show Identification Info). The Code is automatically generated for Objects and can only be changed during registration. Give the Experimental Step a meaningful **Name**, as this will be displayed to the users, review the entries and **Save**. >Note that the new Experimental Step is organized at the same hierarchical level of Objects () in the Lab Notebook left-hand menu.{.is-info} To fill out the Experimental Step form with a [Template](/en/How_to_guides/Templates) predefined for the group by the Data Store Steward, click on the **Templates** tab in the New Experimental Step form, select **Template**, add information to the form as required, review the entries and **Save**. Reload the web page to see the changes.', '## Objects registration - [ ] [Enable Object Types in drop-down menus](/en/How_to_guides/Object_types_in_drop-downs) - [ ] [Create Templates for Experimental Steps and other Objects](/en/How_to_guides/Templates)']
response:
The **'How do I?' guides** (including sections on **Box designs**) are designed to provide **goal-oriented, step-by-step instructions** for using the BAM Data Store and its underlying software, **openBIS**. Their purpose is to help users accomplish specific tasks efficiently, such as:  

- **Registering objects** (e.g., Experimental Steps) at the Object or Collection level.  
- **Managing hierarchical structures** (e.g., organizing Experimental Steps under a Children drop-down menu or aligning them with the Lab Notebook hierarchy).  
- **Utilizing templates** to streamline data entry for consistent workflows.  
- **Configuring system settings** (e.g., enabling Object Types in drop-down menus or setting up Default Experiments).  

These guides ensure users can navigate the BAM Data Store and openBIS interface confidently, even for complex tasks like designing structured data workflows or managing experimental metadata. If a specific function isn‚Äôt covered, the guides direct users to contact the Data Store Team for further assistance.
reference: Here you find "How do I ?" related to functions of the BAM Data Store and its underlying software openBIS. Goal-oriented instructions should help you accomplish specific tasks. If the function you are looking for is missing, please contact the Data Store Team at datastore@bam.de.

user_input: What is the Checklist for Group Settings Customization?
retrieved_contexts:
['# Main menu ## ‚öôÔ∏è Step 1: Access Group Settings 1. In the **left menu**, go to **Utilities**. 2. Click on **Settings**. 3. In the **Select Group Settings** drop-down, choose your **division number**. ---', '## Customize Group Settings - Admin/Data Store Stewards ### Group settings - [Customize the Main menu](Customize_Main_menu) - [Enable Barcodes](Enable_barcodes) ### Templates - [Create Templates for Experimental Steps and other Objects](Templates) ### Object types - [Enable Object Types in drop-downs](Object_types_in_drop-downs) ### Parents and Children sections - [Customize Parents and Children sections in Object Forms](Customize_parents_and_children_sections) - [Add a hint in Parents and Children sections](Add_hint_parents_and_children_sections) ### Storage for Objects - [Enable Storage Widget on Object Form](Storage_position) - [Configure Storage of Objects](New_storage)', 'In the left main menu, under **Utilities** select **Settings**. The Select Group Settings drop-down menu will appear, select your division number to open your group settings. Click on the **Edit** tab and scroll down to the *Object type definitions Extension* section, open the corresponding object type, and enable the **Show in drop-downs** option. You can edit several object types at the same time, review the changes and click on the Save. --- graph TB; The process is as follows: Step 1: Select Settings Step 2: Select division number Step 3: Click on Edit tab Step 4: Scroll down to the section: Object type definitions Extension Step 5: Select an Object type Step 6: Enable Show in drop downs Step 7: Review the changes and Save.', '## Group ELN SettingsIn a multi group instance a *group admin* or *Instance admin* can
customise the ELN Settings for the group.

The group Settings can be selected from the **Settings** in the main
menu.

![image info](../../../_images/menu-settings-multigroup.png)

The Settings for the relevant group can be selected from the available
dropdown, as shown below.

![image info](../../../_images/settings-selection-multigroup.png)

In the group settings the following is configurable:

1. **Storages**. In this section the group storages for samples can be
   created, as described in [Configure Lab
   Storage;](customise-inventory-of-materials-and-samples.html#configure-lab-storage)
2. **Templates**. In this section, the templates for a given *Object
   type* can be created, as described in [Create Templates for
   Objects](create-templates-for-objects.html);
3. **Object types definition extension**. In this section, it is
   possible to:', '## General ELN SettingsIn a multi-group instance an *Instance admin* can customise the General
ELN Settings.

The Settings can be access from the main menu, under **Utilities**.

![image info](../../../_images/menu-settings-multigroup.png)

The General ELN Settings are Settings that are not specific to any of
the defined groups group , as shown below.

![image info](../../../_images/settings-selection-multigroup.png)

The General ELN Settings consist of two parts:']
response:
To customize group settings effectively, follow this structured checklist based on the process and options available:  

1. **Access Group Settings**  
   - Navigate to the **left menu**, select **Utilities**, then click **Settings**.  
   - Use the **Select Group Settings** dropdown to choose your division number (or group).  

2. **Edit Object Type Definitions**  
   - Click the **Edit** tab in the group settings.  
   - Scroll to the **Object type definitions Extension** section.  
   - Enable the **Show in drop-downs** option for relevant object types (you can modify multiple types at once).  

3. **Configure Storage and Templates**  
   - Under **Storages**, create or manage sample storage configurations (if applicable).  
   - In the **Templates** section, define or edit templates for object types (e.g., experimental steps).  

4. **Review and Save Changes**  
   - After making adjustments, review all modifications to ensure accuracy.  
   - Click **Save** to apply your settings.  

5. **Verify Multi-Group Settings (if applicable)**  
   - For multi-group instances, ensure group-specific settings (e.g., ELN configurations) are properly assigned to the correct division/group.  

This process ensures your group settings are tailored to your workflow while maintaining system consistency. Let me know if you need help with specific steps!
reference: This checklist helps you keep track of all group settings and configurations for your department that can be customized by the Data Store Steward.

user_input: What is the Checklist for Use Case implementation?
retrieved_contexts: ['# Example 1 This checklist contains implementation steps that DSSt should consider in order to implement a use case for the division with the goal to improve the discoverability and reusability of research data and simplify the use of Data Store for users.', '## Sharing Use Cases in Wiki Data Store stewards are welcome to share an Use case of your division and make your work visible. We provide a simplified example [EuVSOP](/en/use_cases/EuVSOP) as inspiration for how you can illustrate a use case. In addition, the benefits of the Data Store implementation for the group, project, etc. can be described. Simply send us your text in any format (.docx, .txt, etc.) together with screenshots (.jpg, .png) by email (datastore@bam.de). We will implement your example in the wiki. It is not about waiting for the perfect use case, but about exchanging ideas on how research MSE workflows can be mapped in openBIS Data Store. However, if you need your use case reviewed, please us at datastore@bam.de. - [EuVSOP](/en/use_cases/EuVSOP)', '## ‚úÖ Prerequisites - Access to an openBIS instance - Physical objects to label (e.g., samples, devices) - Barcode/QR code reader (USB or Bluetooth) - Sticker printer or external code generator (optional) ---', 'Step 3: Use a Predefined Template (Optional) If a Template has been predefined by the Data Store Steward for your group, it may be used to populate the Experimental Step form. Click on the Templates tab within the New Experimental Step form, select the appropriate Template, complete any required information, review the entries, and save. Reload the web page to apply the changes. Process Overview The following diagram summarizes the registration process: graph TB; The process is as follows: Step 1: + New Step 2: Select an Object Type: Experimental Step Step 3: Fill out the Experimental Step form or use a predefined Template Step 4: Review all entries carefully and save', '## üöÄ Use Case Implementation - [ ] Automate metadata import from instruments (e.g., generate barcodes). - [ ] Automate metadata import from measurements (e.g., structured tabular data, reuse templates for experimental steps). - [ ] Batch register objects such as inventory items and samples.']
response:
The **Checklist for Use Case Implementation** outlines key steps Data Store Stewards (DSSt) should consider when implementing a use case to improve data discoverability, reusability, and user experience with the Data Store. The core tasks include:  

1. **Automate Metadata Import from Instruments**  
   - Example: Generate barcodes or integrate instrument data to streamline metadata entry.  

2. **Automate Metadata Import from Measurements**  
   - Example: Reuse templates for experimental steps or import structured tabular data to reduce manual input.  

3. **Batch Register Objects**  
   - Example: Efficiently register multiple objects (e.g., inventory items, samples) in bulk to save time and ensure consistency.  

These steps aim to simplify workflows, reduce errors, and align with openBIS/Data Store best practices. Let me know if you‚Äôd like help designing a template or example for your use case!
reference: This checklist contains implementation steps that DSSt should consider in order to implement a use case for the division with the goal to improve the discoverability and reusability of research data and simplify the use of Data Store for users.

user_input: How do you use the Children Generator to create multiple offspring Objects?
retrieved_contexts:
['To assign [Parent and Children](/en/concepts#parent-child-relationship) to Objects of the type - Experimental Step, select relevant Object, click on the **Edit** tab. In the *Parent* and *Children* section, click **Search The process is as follows: Step 1: Click on Edit tab Step 2: Navigate to the Parent and Children sections Step 3: Click Search Any Step 4: Select Object Type Step 5: Enter Code or Name of the Objects to connect Step 6: Review the entries and Save.', 'The children generator function allows to register multiple children simultaneously during the registration of the Object or while editing it. At first, you need to register an Object of Type Experimental Step and defined at least one parent for it (e.g. instruments, chemicals, a sample, etc.). The child generator will allow you to generate Children (e.g., subsequent Experimental Steps) with a defined combination of Parents. To do this, select the **Experimental Step** with registered Parents. Click on the **Edit** tab, scroll down to the *Parents* and *Children* section in the Experimental Step form, and click on the **Generate Children** tab. A matrix of Parents is displayed in the *Children Generator* form. Select all Parents, choose the **Experimental Step** in the *Object type* drop-down menu and enter the number of replicates of newly generated Children, and click on **Generate**. Review the entries and **Save**. >Note, to ensure the traceability of the data in the Data Store, a minimum set of mandatory Properties has been defined for some Object Types. The child generator only allows the registration of Objects with **non-mandatory** Properties, as the Object form cannot be edited. It is therefore only possible to register multiple Objects of various Object Types with the child-parents relationship simultaneously using the [Batch registration](/en/How_to_guides/Batch_registration_Inventory) function.{.is-info}', '--- graph TB; The process is as follows: Step 1: Click on Edit tab Step 2: Scroll down to the Parents and Children section Step 3: Click on Generate Children tab Step 4: Choose Experimental Step in the Object type drop-down menu Step 5: Enter the number of new child(ren) Step 6: Review and click on Generate', '## Add parents and children to Experimental Steps

### **Adding and Removing Children**

The **Children Generator** creates a matrix of all the parents entered
in the *Experimental Step*, as shown below. Combinations of parents
needed to generate children can then be selected by the user. The
*Object* type to assign to the children and the number of replicas need
to be specified. The children will then be automatically generated by
openBIS upon registration of the *Experimental Step*.

![](../../_images/children-generator-1024x477.png)



### Parent-child relationships between entries in lab notebookIn the Lab Notebook section, if you create a new *Object* from an
existing *Object*, independently of the type, this will be automatically
set as parent of the new Object. For example, if you create a new
Experimental Step (measurement 4) from an existing Experimental Step
(measurement 3), this will be automatically set as child of measurement
3, as shown below.', '## Add parents and children to Experimental Steps

### Adding a parent

3. Scan the barcode/QR code of the entry you want to add as parent with
   a scanner or with the camera of a mobile device
4. Click on the **Add Objects** button
5. **Close**



### Removing a parentTo remove a parent, choose **Remove** from the **Operations** drop down in the parent table, as shown below.

![](../../_images/remove-parents-1024x313.png)



### **Adding and Removing Children**Children of *Experimental Steps* are usually derivative *Experimental
Steps,* or products of the *Experimental Step.* As for the **Parents**
section, this section can also be customised by a *group admin* or *lab
manager* in the **ELN Settings** ([Customise Parents and Children Sections in Object Forms)](../general-admin-users/admins-documentation/customise-parents-and-children-sections-in-object-forms.html).

The procedure for adding and removing children is the same as explained
for parents.

#### Children Generator']
response:
To use the **Children Generator** to create multiple offspring Objects (e.g., Experimental Steps), follow these steps:  

1. **Register a Parent Object**: First, ensure the parent Object (e.g., an Experimental Step) is already registered and has at least one parent (e.g., an instrument, sample, or chemical) defined.  
2. **Edit the Parent Object**: Click the **Edit** tab for the parent Experimental Step.  
3. **Access the Children Generator**: Scroll down to the **Parents and Children** section and click **Generate Children**.  
4. **Select Object Type**: In the *Object type* dropdown menu, choose **Experimental Step** (or the desired Object type).  
5. **Specify Replicates**: Enter the number of child Objects you want to generate (e.g., 3 replicates).  
6. **Generate and Save**: Click **Generate** to create the child Objects. Review the entries and click **Save** to finalize.  

The Children Generator automatically creates the specified number of child Objects with the defined parent relationships. Note that this tool only supports Objects with **non-mandatory** Properties; for mandatory Properties, use the **Batch registration** function instead. This ensures traceability and proper data management in the Data Store.
reference: The children generator function allows to register multiple children simultaneously during the registration of the Object or while editing it. At first, you need to register an Object of Type Experimental Step and defined at least one parent for it (e.g. instruments, chemicals, a sample, etc.). The child generator will allow you to generate Children (e.g., subsequent Experimental Steps) with a defined combination of Parents. To do this, select the Experimental Step with registered Parents. Click on the Edit tab, scroll down to the Parents and Children section in the Experimental Step form, and click on the Generate Children tab. A matrix of Parents is displayed in the Children Generator form. Select all Parents, choose the Experimental Step in the Object type drop-down menu and enter the number of replicates of newly generated Children, and click on Generate . Review the entries and Save .

Navigate to the relevant Default Experiment and select the + New tab. From the Select an Object Type drop-down menu, select Experimental Step. Step 2: Complete the Experimental Step Form Fill out the New Experimental Step form. To display the Identification Info, open the More drop-down menu and select Show Identification Info, if it is not already visible. The Code is automatically generated and can only be modified during the registration process. Assign a meaningful Name to the Experimental Step, as this name will be displayed to users. Please review all entries carefully before saving. ‚öóÔ∏è Note: The new Experimental Step will be organized at the same hierarchical level as other Objects in the left-hand menu of the Laboratory Notebook.', 'To register non-sequential Experimental steps, register a new [Object](/en/concepts#object) at the Collection level (Default Experiment). Navigate to relevant - Default Experiment, click the **+ New** tab, select **Experimental Step** in the Select an object type drop-down menu. Fill out the New Experimental Step form, display Identification Info (if hidden, open the More drop-down menu and select Show Identification Info). The Code is automatically generated for Objects and can only be changed during registration. Give the Experimental Step a meaningful **Name**, as this will be displayed to the users, review the entries and **Save**. >Note that the new Experimental Step is organized at the same hierarchical level of Objects () in the Lab Notebook left-hand menu.{.is-info} To fill out the Experimental Step form with a [Template](/en/How_to_guides/Templates) predefined for the group by the Data Store Steward, click on the **Templates** tab in the New Experimental Step form, select **Template**, add information to the form as required, review the entries and **Save**. Reload the web page to see the changes.', '# Lab NotebookIn the most common use-cases, the **Lab Notebook** part of the openBIS ELN-LIMS contains a personal Space (i.e. folder) for each scientist. Within this *Space*, scientists can organise their work using the openBIS *Projects, Experiments and Objects.*

An openBIS *Experiment* is defined as a specific scientific question. The individual attempts to answer this question, are *Objects* of type *Experimental Step*. At this level, the user can create links to *materials* and *methods* registered in the Inventory that were used to perform the *Experimental Step*. These are entered as *Parents* of the *Experimental Step*. All data produced in the *Experimental Step* and further processed and analysed can be added at this level.

It is also possible to organise the Lab Notebook on *Projects*, rather than on personal Spaces. This should be configured by an *Instance admin*.']
response:
To link Inventory Objects to Experimental Steps in the Lab Notebook, follow these steps:  

1. **Select the Inventory Object**: Navigate to the Inventory item you want to connect.  
2. **Edit the Object**: Click the **Edit** tab. In the **Parent** and **Children** section, click **Search Any**.  
3. **Choose Experimental Step**: From the *Select an object type* drop-down menu, choose **Experimental step**.  
4. **Enter Code or Name**: Input the **Code or Name** of the Experimental Step you want to link. Start typing to filter available options, then select the correct one.  
5. **Save Changes**: Confirm the link by clicking **Save**.  

**Additional Tips**:  
- To visualize the hierarchy of linked objects, use the **Hierarchy Graph** (accessible via the *More* drop-down menu).  
- For multiple links, use **Paste Any** to input codes/names directly, then review and save.  

This process establishes a connection between the Inventory Object and the Experimental Step, enabling data traceability and contextual organization in the Lab Notebook.
reference: To connect an Inventory Object to an Experimental Step, select the relevant inventory Object and click on the Edit tab. In the Parent and Children section, click Search Any and select Experimental step from the Select an object type drop-down menu. You will be returned to the Update-Object form. Enter the Code or Name of the Object in the text box that will appear below the Parents section. Start typing the Code or Name of the Parent-Object to display available Objects for your group, select the appropriate Object and Save . To display linked Objects in a hierarchy graph, navigate to the edited Inventory item, click the More drop-down menu, and select Hierarchy Graph. It is also possible to define multiple Parents and Children to Objects at the same time. To do this, use the Paste Any option, enter the Code or Name of respective Objects, review the entries and Save . You can copy the Code or Name of Objects from another ELN page (Log in to the BAM Data Store in another/private browser window). Paste the Codes(s) or name(s) in the text fields, review and Save .

To access Group Settings from the Main Menu, follow these steps:

2. **Open Settings**: From the Utilities menu, select **Settings**.  
3. **Select Your Group**: In the **Select Group Settings** dropdown, choose your **division number** (or group identifier).
